items.title: Graphic Designer (entry level)
items.content:
We have an exciting opportunity for a Junior Graphic Designer to support our Marketing Team.


Whether you’ve just graduated or you are in a junior position, this role will allow you to gain some experience working with a start-up in London. You will create assets for website and email to support our Marketing activities. We are looking for someone with a “can do” attitude, a creative mindset and a keen eye for detail. 


Experience using Adobe Creative Suite is preferred - proficiency in Photoshop is essential.


This role will be remote and to work between 4 and 5 days per month. 


Please send a couple of sentences about yourself and any examples of your work along with your application.


 


About Live Better With


 


We are a London-based start-up that aims to make life with a long-term health condition a little easier - with helpful products, information, and a place to find your community.

items.content:
Visual Designer

Full-time
Brooklyn, NY
Remote job
Studio
Posted Today – Accepting applications

Milkshake Studio is seeking an exceptionally talented Designer to join our team. As a Milkshake Designer you’ll be working within a close-knit team of designers and developers.  You will be responsible for brand concepts, user experience and wireframing, user interface design, prototyping, and creating successful products. You’ll be participating in client discussions and collaborating closely with them to realise their digital ideas. To succeed, you’ll need to be detail focused, team oriented, and someone who pushes the boundaries.

We want you to be yourself and be inclined to take risks that expand your creativity. You would work from our office in Brooklyn, and remote if needed.

 
What you’ll be doing:

You will be an integral part of our team. Working directly with clients and our development team as well as on internal projects.  You will be involved in the full project lifecycle: strategy, design iteration, prototyping, all the way to the final product.

  • Delivering (along with your team) visual design components on time within projects
  • Presenting concepts and ideas for clients
  • Inspiring both colleagues and clients
  • Playing an important role during our UX process
  • The ability to manage your time wisely and keep your team up-to-date
Some stuff about you:
  • You are detailed oriented
  • You’re a nice person and work hard
  • You have a killer portfolio
  • You care as much about fonts as your own pet 
  • You are not discouraged by feedback
  • You have some knowledge of HTML/CSS (development skills are a plus)
  • You can use the Adobe Creative Suite and Sketch
  • You like working on all mediums: print, web, mobile, native apps, and whatever else you can create
Compensation:
  • Competitive salary
  • Snacks, coffee,  and beer
  • An open office environment
  • Profit Share
  • Flexible holiday schedule
  • Health, Dental and Vision Plans available.

Hire Me:

Shoot an email over to Jobs@milkshake.studio and include a link to your work (website, dribbble, behance, etc.) and anything else you want to show us.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=36, embedded=0, frontend=6}
items.content:
Virtual Marketing Assistant – Website Designer at Equivity

Remote | Part-time
  • Remote job
  • Job openings

Job description

Equivity is looking for a part-time marketing professional who is proficient with all things website-related, from troubleshooting to creating to supporting clients with website strategy and design. The selected candidate will offer website support and consultation for clients in need of a new website, redesign of a current site, and well-informed suggestions for improving traffic and visibility. In addition, the selected candidate will be available to clients to troubleshoot and solve problems such as website restorations, plug-in issues, updates and theme adjustments.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience utilizing WordPress, Drupal, SquareSpace, and Wix. This person will also be proficient in eCommerce platforms, including Shopify, WooCommerce, and E-Bay integration. Technical website expertise and advanced website design and maintenance skills are also required. A strong background with CSS and advanced HTML coding, as well as front-end and back-end website development expertise will be necessary. This person will have built websites from scratch to the specifications of clients and companies across all platforms mentioned above. We are looking for somebody who has at least three years of experience specifically as a website expert.

If you are looking for a long-term role helping clients in a broad range of industries reach their marketing goals through website design and maintenance, and are the sort of self-starter who can remain highly productive while working from home, we want to hear from you!

More about our company:

Equivity provides virtual marketing support to clients, including individuals and small businesses, looking for assistance expanding their marketing reach. Marketing VAs typically assist clients on an ongoing basis by setting up, maintaining, and optimizing digital marketing campaigns. Examples of these campaigns include automated email marketing campaigns; Facebook, Instagram and Google Ads PPC campaigns; creating blogs and revising website content according to SEO guidelines; and organic social media posting. As a virtual marketing assistant with Equivity, you will have the opportunity to work with a variety of clients to achieve their marketing goals.

As a virtual marketing assistant with Equivity, you will have the opportunity to build a portfolio of different clients, with whom you would work to achieve their marketing goals. Our virtual assistants work with a high degree of autonomy and are responsible for developing relationships with our clients. Because we provide extremely attentive service to our clients, you must be available to respond to client communications during business hours within one hour by email, phone, and text and be available to work on projects during the business day. All of this work is done remotely, meaning that you can work from home.

The selected candidate would be hired as a part-time employee of Equivity, not an independent contractor. We are looking for somebody who has at least 20 hours per week of availability, and the starting pay is $19.00 per hour. We are a growing business and are looking for a digital marketer who is excited to partner with us and is interested in a long-term role with our company.

Qualities we are looking for:

  • Organization
  • Dedication
  • Initiative
  • Reliability
  • Attention to detail
  • Resourcefulness
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Responsiveness
  • Ability to work independently with limited oversight

Requirements

Position requirements:

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • 3+ years of experience in a website designer or website manager role
  • Experience with WordPress, Drupal, SquareSpace and Wix
  • Experience with e-Commerce tools such as Shopify, WooCommerce and E-Bay integration
  • Experience designing and maintaining websites
  • Technical website design and advanced troubleshooting skills
  • CSS background and advanced HTML coding background
  • Ability to design a website from scratch, top to bottom
  • Availability to respond to requests within an hour during the hours of 9 AM – 6 PM, Monday – Friday
  • Your own laptop and smart phone with broadband access to Internet
  • Quiet location in which to take phone calls
Apply for job

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=13}
items.content:
UI/UX Designer

Full-time
Richmond, VA
Remote job
Studio
Posted Today – Accepting applications
We are looking for a thoughtful, detail-oriented designer to be the next member of our growing developer-owned, remote-friendly, people-first, hyphen-loving company. 

 
Candidates need to have experience designing for screens and building components and layouts for the web. The ideal candidate would be eager to collaborate on a growing team with plenty of opportunities for shaping their own role.
 
If you have experience designing production web applications and are passionate about collaborating with clients and teammates, then we want to talk!
 
Skills & Requirements
  • Loves to work directly with customers to solve business problems
  • Experience and comfort with some UX design practices and deliverables
  • Experience designing production web applications
  • Comfort with design, UI and prototyping tools (Sketch, Adobe Suite, inVision, Zepelin, and/or Figma)
  • Considerable experience with HTML/CSS/JavaScript
 
Nice-to-haves
  • Being within easy driving distance of Richmond or Charlottesville is a HUGE plus!
  • Experience and comfort across the spectrum of UX research and design practices
  • Comfort with accessibility
  • Comfortable contributing code in varied templating languages and systems
  • Experience with front-end JavaScript frameworks
  • Comfort with version control (github)
  • Public portfolio
  • Experience creating high fidelity mockups
  • Ready to advise project teams on design principles, usability and interactions
  • Ready to consult with project owners and end users to identify application requirements
 
Passion for at least a few of the following items
  • Typography
  • Animation
  • Writing
  • Atomic design
  • Component/pattern libraries and style guides
  • Flexbox and grid
  • Whatever is on the bleeding edge of CSS
  • Accessibility
  • Clickable Prototypes
  • User-centered design methods and techniques
  • User research
  • User testing
  • Growing a product design team
 
What We Offer
  • A Great Team - Our team of engineers and designers is the best part of working here. We only hire people who are fantastic teammates – competent and smart, sure, but also humble, positive, and generous.
  • Great Clients - We work with mostly small and medium clients, for whom our projects make a huge impact. We prioritize clients who are pleasant and good to work with, people who share our values of transparency and empathy.
  • Work From Home - We are a distributed company. Everyone works from home, though the leadership team all live in central Virginia.
  • Negligible Travel - In general, we don’t travel routinely for projects. If this is a specific concern, we’re happy to discuss.
  • Flexible Work Schedule - We require a certain amount of overlap with the rest of the team, but if you have a predictable schedule, we can probably support it, e.g., ending at 3:30 every day or being out every Friday morning.
  • Good Work Life Balance (really) - We ask our team to work 40 hours a week*. That’s all: a good, productive 40 hours. And then we try our best to leave you alone off the clock. We do this in part because that’s how we want to live but also because we want our team to be recharged and ready to do their best when working. *If you need to work fewer than 40 hours, that might be possible too; let’s talk.
  • Competitive Compensation - We offer highly competitive salary and benefits, including generous time off, 401k, FSA, medical and dental insurance.

items.title: UX Designer
items.content:
UX Designer

Company: CLEVER°FRANKE
Location:
Requires Work Permit
Level: Intermediate
Language: English
UX / UI Designer
Skills:
  • Design
  • Digital Design
  • Scrum
  • UX Design

    • Intro

    WHAT WE DO

    CLEVER°FRANKE connects people to data and technology. Every day we create innovative tools and experiences that solve complex challenges. We work with top-tier clients from across the globe to leverage the power of data. Our work ranges from cross-platform digital solutions and interactive installations to traditional branding and print/artwork. 

    UX DESIGN AT CLEVER°FRANKE

    We are looking for ambitious candidates with exceptional skills who are eager to learn, have a sharp eye for quality and an affinity with all things digital. You will explore complex data and design the required functionalities and content for our digital tools and experiences, to help the user achieve their goals and the client achieve their business objectives. 
    Some of the responsibilities of a UX designer:

    • Define the design brief and project approach together with the client;
    • Run interviews and stakeholder workshops;
    • Work with the team to get all required information on user, business, data and technology;
    • Consider and shape the strategy for the product or service;
    • Design a creative concept design for the product interfaces and other touch points;
    • Work with the team to ensure qualitative delivery through (agile) development.


    UX Designer at CLEVER°FRANKE from CLEVER°FRANKE 

    Main requirements

    • Your ambition, eagerness to learn and a sharp eye for quality;
    • Solid experience in UI/UX design within complex projects and/or organizations;
    • Great communication skills;
    • You know how to engage clients and conduct meaningful workshops;
    • You can define a project's vision and steer a team towards that vision.

    Nice to have

    • When you have a SCRUM Product Owner certificate ;
    • Have experience with data visualization;
    • Have a strong affinity for data and technology.

    Perks

    • Challenging projects to flex your creative muscle;
    • A friendly, passionate, down to earth team that will inspire, challenge and help you grow professionally
    • A competitive salary, based on your background and experience
    • A healthy, abundant lunch every day
    • Paid train expenses from your home to the office
    • A personal development coach and time to explore your interests
    • A personal MacBook and all the peripherals you need
    • A sitting / standing desk (and mini pot plant to liven up your desk)
    • Inspiring team events; such our annual team prototyping day, team trainings, sport events, conference visits, etc.

items.title: Proofread/Edit a 2000 Word Article about Branding/Graphic Design
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=8, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Proofread/Edit a 2000 Word Article about Branding/Graphic Design

Company: Logo Coast
Location: Remotely
Job Type: Freelance
Description

Hi, I'm looking to connect with a professional writer. I previously worked with another writer who created a bunch of articles for my logo/graphic design blog. The articles are pretty good, but they always have room for improvement.

Overall I tend to strive for:
- Professional (yet personable)
- Informative
- Relatable
- Easy to Read

To get a feel for my preferred writing style/voice, please check one of the currently published articles here - https://logocoast.com/blog/top-ten-tips-create-tagline/

You will have the freedom to revise the article however you see fit. Feel free to remove/rework sentences or even entire paragraphs, improve grammar, etc. As long as the article is to the point and reads well, that's all that matters.

Below I'm attaching 2 paragraphs from an article I have available. If you'd be willing to provide a quick sample, this is the best way for me to determine who is a great fit for this project. The article is about Gradient Design.

-----

Gradients took the design world by storm in the 90’s, but they still have a place in modern design. Not all designs will look great with gradient design, however, using gradients can be a great way to enhance flat designs. It’s also a great way to add color or texture to an image.

Using gradient design works better for specific kinds of brands so we wanted to share with you some of our favorite gradient designs and talk about why these designs work for these particular brands. If your brand has a similar aesthetic or these designs appeal to you, you might want to consider asking your designer for gradient design elements in your logo design or other graphic design elements for your marketing materials.

------

Please bid for just (1) 2000 word article, but also note how much you would charge for a larger order (for example, 10 articles). All of the articles I have available for editing are all right around 2000 words. I'm not worried about the final word count. If some of these articles benefit from removing some of the "fluff" that's totally fine and welcomed.

Please feel free to ask me any questions and I'd be happy to discuss further.

Thank you!

items.content:
Unnamed Seed Stage Startup | Founding Engineer OR Founding Design/Product Role | Remote and Bay Area | Full Time

We are a new startup in the UX design tool space, with a mission to radically lower the barriers needed to build full-fidelity prototypes and products, and bridging the design-engineering gap. The stage is very early, pre-product, but we have enthusiastic early feedback.

The team of four has three ex-founders. We've previously built startups where we've hired over 100 roles, sold to 20% of F500s, raised over $45mm in aggregate, gotten the businesses acquired, and built/ran teams of engineers from MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Google, FB, YC, MSR.

We received strong funding offers from a number of top tier VCs. We’re lucky to be working with a senior GP at our lead investor, along with a number of esteemed angels/funds, including well-known leaders in the design community.

We're looking for two more individuals:

- Founding generalist engineer. No particular tech specialization necessary (we use Typescript and React), but we’re ideally looking for a product-oriented engineer who has deep frontend experience.

- Founding design/product role - someone who has worked in a few different orgs (esp. the big product tech companies with strong design), knows their design tools, is interested in or has done product work, and has an extensive network of designers / can wear the evangelist hat.

In either role, you would be directly shaping everything from product direction to team to culture.

If interested, please drop us a line ASAP at designtoolstartup@googlegroups.com. Thanks, we're excited to hear from you!

items.title: UX/UI Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Here at Situ we are creating imaginative places set to change how people discover innovative products and services from the world’s leading brands.


We are just at the start of our journey and the path ahead will be exhilarating as we get ready to open our first venue in central London.


Our tech team who are creating our inspiring platform need some additional support and so we are now looking for a home-based UX/UI designer who lives within commutable distance of the Manchester area.  The role is permanent but contract may be considered for the right candidate.


The ideal candidate is someone who can turn our ideas into intuitive and easy to use applications that provide relevant experiences to users. This person will be involved in the entire process of design from branding, usability and function. They will be required to design the UX/UI for native mobile applications as well as responsive web applications including UI elements such as menus, tables and other popular UI elements.


Requirements:



  • Be a team player who works well in an agile team environment

  • Can work closely with designers and developers

  • Gather requirements for interfaces

  • Design flows, wireframes and prototypes for the team

  • Identify and solve UX issues, for example, responsive UIs

  • Keep up to date with industry standards


Essential experience:



  • Proven examples of UI/UX projects

  • Knowledge of wireframe/prototyping tools

  • Knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator and other design tools

  • Portfolio of existing work

  • Understanding of responsive websites

  • Experience with working in an agile environment


If this all sounds exciting and you feel ready for the challenge of joining a start-up organisation, then we would be delighted to receive your cv.

items.title: Web Designer (Remote)
items.content:
A skilled designer with a modern design aesthetic required by distributed organisation.


Should have good website, branding and message skills and be able to advise on Webapp UX/UI. Most importantly should be a great team player with the energy and determination to get things done.


Please provide a portfolio as part of your application.


Note that this is a co-founder position.


We are remote and believe that work should revolve around our lives. However we have members in London, Berlin and Lisbon if you prefer co-location.


About Us: Audacity create platforms and systems for distributed teams. We believe human relationships are paramount in any distributed organisation and have made this central not only in how we operate as an organisation but also in the tools which we develop.

items.title: Graphic Designer
items.content:
We are Ultimate Football Fan and we represent some of the biggest names in Football Fan influeners. We create social content, documentaries and are the team behind Blud Bruvvas the show that lets the fans take the field and do their talking on the pitch. 


We are looking for a talented designer to work on ad-hoc basis creating sales decks for our reality shows, bespoke content documentaries and other football related content.     



  •  Telling a visual story, and creating fantastic look and feel for brands, using our content or   football related material 

  • Creating great mood decks

  • Creating decks that incorporate data and heavy detail that is still visually interesting and easy to understand

  • Creating design concepts for business and internal use

  • Contributing to the copy within the deck

  • Experience creating material for pitching concepts and ideas

  • An interest in sports is a bonus but not required


Ideally you will live in or near London so you can come to the office once a week but the role can be entirely remote for the right person. 


We will work on a weekly basis, paying a base fee of £50 - £250 per deck, depending on amount of work;  but with an added commission % of the budget for any deck that wins work.


Please provide a covering letter and a link to your portfolio.

items.content:
We are an international team of lawyers and technologists, working to reinvent the startup law experience from the ground up. Clara graduated from Techstars Dubai’s class of 2019 and closed a USD 2,000,000 seed round before expanding into London. We move fast (but thoughtfully), and are looking for a talented and impact-oriented UX/UI Designer to join us.


As part of a startup, your responsibilities will vary, but on a day to day basis, you will:



  • Translate concepts into user flows, wireframes, mockups and prototypes for a wide range of devices and interfaces that lead to intuitive user experiences and effectively communicate interaction and design ideas

  • Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals and experience

  • Present and defend designs and key milestone deliverables to peers and executive level stakeholders

  • Make strategic design and user-experience decisions related to core and new functions and features.

  • Take a user-centered design approach and rapidly test and iterate your designs.

  • Execute all visual design stages from concept to final hand-off to engineering

  • Establish and promote design guidelines, best practices and standards


We are looking for someone who: 



  • shares our philosophy; 

  • is capable and excited about the role; 

  • strives for personal and professional excellence; 

  • and wants to make a meaningful difference through their work. 


The opportunity is for you if you have:



  • Proven work experience as a UI/UX Designer or similar role with a portfolio of design projects

  • Proficiency in Photoshop, Illustrator, OmniGraffle, or other visual design and wire-framing tools as well as standard UX software such as Figma, Sketch, OmniGraffle, Axure, InVision, UXPin, Balsamiq, Framer, and the like is a must. Basic HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript skills are a plus.

  • Ability to work effectively in a remote team setting including synthesizing abstract ideas into concrete design implications.

  • Be excited about collaborating and communicating closely with teams and other stakeholders via a distributed model, to regularly deliver design solutions for approval.

  • BS/MS in Human-Computer Interaction, Interaction Design, or related

  • Experience working in an Agile/Scrum/Kanban development process

  • A solid grasp of user-centered design (UCD), planning and conducting user research, user testing, A/B testing, rapid prototyping, heuristic analysis, usability and accessibility concerns.

  • Be open to receiving feedback and constructive criticism.

  • Up-to-date with the latest UI/UX trends, techniques, and technologies


Minimum Requirements:



  • At least 5 years of UI/UX experience in a well known software environment

  • BSc in Design, Computer Science or relevant field

  • Must be fluent (written/spoken) in English.

  • Solid oral, written, presentation and interpersonal communication skills.

  • Preference will be given to candidates who have experience designing complex solutions for data driven software functionality

We are an early-stage AI startup in the family travel sector. We are looking to work with an exceptional UX/UI designer (focussing more on quality and not quantity of experience) to help us design and build our MVP. We are based in London but open to remote designers outside of London. 


All options are on the table - fixed price short term contract, daily rate, etc. We are currently funded by angel investors. Post MVP, if we like you and you like us, we could progress into a permanent role with equity options. 


MVP -> Would be a conversational interface built as a progressive web app.


What we expect from you: 



  1. A portfolio showing experience in web and mobile UI/UX standards 

  2. Experience with Sketch or similar

  3. Knowledge/exposure/experience with Invision or similar. 

  4. Portfolio of work in travel industry - A nice to have

  5. Experience designing a chatbot based interface - A nice to have. 


What we offer: 



  1. An opportunity to disrupt an industry and a customer segment largely underserved - family segment. 

  2. Collaborate with an awesome founding team - who come from very senior roles in travel and fintech prior to the startup.

  3. Remote working where/when needed. We are currently based in London.

items.title: UI/UX Designer
items.content:
Finding funding for scientific research and completing the necessary applications is time-consuming. Hiring in this industry is difficult largely due to the high degree of specialisation for projects. Founded and shaped by scientists, Lit Lab gives researchers the resources that they need to do great work, helping to fund research and find talent. 


We’re looking for a UX/UI designer to build the interface for our web app. This can built remotely while maintaining a dialogue with the founding team. The chosen candidate will receive £2000 upon completion of the project. Performance will be evaluated and the opportunity to join the company for a proportion of equity may be offered. 


Currently Lit Lab has demoed a prototype to a lab with a research focus on cancer genetics, this validated the idea indicating that we’re trying to solve a compelling problem. We’ve started work on the back end of the site and are looking to have something fully-functional by the end of the year. This is an exciting opportunity to work for a startup looking to advance scientific research. Anybody that wants to do meaningful work and create a truly awesome product should apply.

items.content:
Rich Clicks is a fast-growing award-winning digital marketing company based in London specialized in the Italian and also European markets.


What are we looking for in an applicant?


We are looking for one creative, smart and autonomous Front End Designer (possibly Italian Speaker)


We’re looking for an innovator, a multi-talented person who can help us in one of the essential areas of our business. We're looking for a Junior / Middle level of experience so 1/2 years ideally.


So what does the role actually involve?



  • Front End design on various platform: Wordpress, Shopify, Unbounce, etc.



  • Create creative visual concepts and ideas forBanners, Landing Pages, Email Marketing, etc.

  • Landing Page Design, using various platforms such as Sharpspring, Unbounce, Leadpages or even custom HTML.

  • Learn how to design on our Marketing Automation Platform for Landing pages, Newsletters, mini-websites.

  • Managing projects and ongoing activities with precision and reliability.

  • Work in close relationship with the Digital Marketing Consultants and our Senior Web Developer.


Required Education, Skills and Qualifications



  • Good knowledge of HTML, CSS and Javascript

  • Attention to details, even the smallest ones (this is very important)

  • Working following a methodology.

  • Multi-project ability, time-management, and forward planning.

  • Capability to take accountability of the tasks and propose solutions design-wise.

  • Curiosity, willing to learn and being updated.


Something More About Us:



  • We're a team of 16 people, mostly Italians, close and friendly but also very well organized.

  • We follow an AGILE/SCRUM Methodology to plan our weeks in advance.

  • We'll give you one more day off for every year you work with us.

  • We give the possibility to work from home when necessary

  • We have free coffee/tea at the office, a truly authentic Italian espresso coffee :)

  • We offer a Birthday day off because we think that you should celebrate instead of working.



  • We often organize internal and external training

  • We like to be transparent and you'll work in an open office with the team and the founders.

  • We organize Fun Fridays!

  • We are RichClicks and we are innovators!


As a part of the hiring process, your knowledge will be tested during the interviews and we require a portfolio.


Salary


The Salary range is not shown because we would keep the position open to who has more seniority, we'd like to evaluate your experience and then make a proposal that could reward your experience.

items.content:
DESCRIPTION


We're a VC-backed digital insurer of the future. We use machine learning, automation, our own technology stack and comprehensive data integrations to be quicker, cheaper and fairer to customers, and are looking for a graphic designer to communicate a fresh approach - to both our customers and potential employees.


We're a team of 35 with experience at the likes of Intercom, Monzo, Transferwise, Depop, backed by investors who have backed Spotify, Monzo, Adyen and others. Over the next 2 years we will grow the team to 150, as we expand our revenue product offering and geography - pushing further in to the multi-trillion $ insurance market.


THE ROLE


As a Graphic Designer, you will be working with our senior management team, marketing and HR to present an online image of Marshmallow that enthuses customers and prospective employees about Marshmallow's mission.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Conceptualising & designing Marshmallow's brand image for both customers and prospective empolyees

  • Define Marshmallow's presence on the web

  • Inspire potential customers & promote our brand image across marketing content & advertising across digital & print

  • Continue to build the relationship with our customers by leading on customer facing communications & assets

  • Work closely with customer operations, design & product teams

  • Manage multiple briefs and organise your time effectively and independently

  • Develop and present ideas for stakeholders and the wider team to see

  • Define brand guidelines across all mediums


REQUIREMENTS



  • 1+ commercial experience

  • Strong visual aesthetic with high level of finished product demonstrating understanding of quality communication design

  • Strong communication skills both in your work and your character

  • Multidiscipline approach - able to work across multiple medium

  • Passion for the details, output and application of your work

  • Someone with strong organisational skills, taking the initiative

  • Confident ability using a range of creative tooling including: Figma, Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign


Bonus skills



  • Understanding of CSS3, HTML5 & Javascript (jQuery or similar)

  • Animation using After Effects, CSS animations or similar

  • Video editing experience


WHO WILL YOU BE WORKING WITH


Closely with our lead product designer, and the designer who has been managing brand thus far......Jason: https://www.linkedin.com/in/jsnford/


CULTURE


https://www.notion.so/getmarshmallow/Company-Values-e798b5c1fce54e8789274cf83c978831


BENEFITS



  • Competitive salary 

  • Stock options 

  • Working from home 

  • Monthly Socials 

  • 32 day holiday allowance (inc bank holidays) 

  • Pension 

  • Cycle to work scheme 

  • Unlimited books 

  • Equipment you need to get the job done 

  • Weekly knowledge sharing presentations 

  • Friday all-hands with snacks 

  • Learning and training supported 

  • Fruit, snacks and soft drinks in the office 

  • Health insurance 


INTERVIEW PROCESS


1) 30-45 minute phone call


2) Design task where we ask you to design something specific and ask for your 'process' (task should take 2-4 hours)


3) On-site

items.content:
Motorway is reinventing how cars are bought and sold online. Our mission is to bring the car industry into the future through ground-breaking products and best in class design.


In 2017 we launched the first comparison website for selling your car. With a few taps, customers can compare live offers for their car, select the best deal and sell within 24 hours. Since then we have grown significantly and recently launched Motorway Pro, a platform for dealers to search and buy cars online.


We are now looking for a talented Visual Designer to help create the next phase of Motorway’s journey.


About the role


As part of a four-person design team, you’ll be responsible for creating design work across the business, including:



  • Advertising creatives for offline and out-of-home campaigns

  • Emails, banners, videos and widgets to support our online marketing, content, social media and CRM campaigns

  • Branded merchandise and clothing

  • Illustrations and icon design

  • UI design and page layouts for our digital products and websites

  • Signage, branding and interior design for our offices in Brighton and London

  • Lots of other top secret features and projects we’re working on but can’t talk about publicly


You’ll create design work for our consumer brand (motorway.co.uk) and our Pro brand used by car dealers (pro.motorway.co.uk).


What we’re looking for



  • Some commercial experience in a design role or internship, demonstrated by a strong portfolio. 

  • An ability to solve real problems through design, demonstrated by examples of projects or features that have had a measurable impact on the business or organisation

  • Strong aesthetic ability and visual taste, resulting in work that is powerful and beautiful to behold. 

  • Typography, colour, illustration, photography, icons, branding… you are all over this

  • An exceptional eye for detail and a precise, accurate approach to creating design work

  • Experience with design tools such as Adobe CC and Sketch, and collaboration tools like Dropbox and Slack, plus strong Mac skills

  • Comfortable collaborating with different areas of the business, such as commercial, marketing or development teams

  • A personal interest and passion for visual creativity, be it art, product design, graphic design or photography

  • Strong verbal and written communication and presentation skills

  • A friendly, positive personality with a willingness to work hard and as part of a team

  • Ambition to develop and be the best at what you do


What we offer



  • A competitive salary and equity package

  • The chance to join a rapidly growing company that cares first and foremost about its people

  • The chance to work with an experienced entrepreneurial team, with a big vision

  • Fast career progression and the ability to develop your own skills and experience quickly

  • Flexible working, with the option to work from home or remotely some of the time

  • Enhanced Maternity/Paternity leave that increases with tenure

  • Regular social events

items.content:
About us

At TransferGo we are on a mission to make moving money globally as simple and easy as sending a text. We aim to make life easier for anyone sending money abroad by removing the processes and fees that traditional banking institutions have.

We are a fast growing FinTech company with an international team of more than 150 employees, great product and a service available in 47 countries, with the goal to provide the best customer service every step of the way.

About the Role

Our team is in search of a Visual Designer to help us spread the TransferGo message across the world with engaging visuals. This person will be a crucial part of the Marketing Department located in London and will work closely with the Design Director and the other designers in the team.

This role offers the opportunity to be fully involved in the strategy and production of marketing and brand initiatives, as well as the chance to design visual outputs across a wide range of media.

What you’ll do:



  • Help to create and maintain a consistent visual brand across all our marketing channels.

  • Strategise and design visuals for multiple channels and media (digital, social media, web, OOH, print, tv).

  • Collaborate with multiple stakeholders across the whole organisation.


Requirements

What you’ll bring:



  • 3+ years of design experience in a brand, marketing or agency environment.

  • Fluency across graphic design, typography, illustration, and photography.

  • Ability to produce quality work under tight deadlines and to juggle across multiple projects.

  • Proactivity and problem-solving attitude, ideas that challenge the ordinary, together with the drive –­ and the guts – to bring them to life.

  • ‘Here to help’ attitude and the belief that working in a team is much better than doing it alone - even when it requires giving and receiving feedback.

  • A portfolio of past work samples and the process behind them.

  • +1 if you have experience:

    • In creating original Illustration and/or animations;

    • In video recording/editing;

    • In web design and/or coding;

    • With creative writing.




Benefits



  • Being part of extremely exciting and growing Fintech startup community.

  • Competitive salary package.

  • Flexible working hours with opportunity to work from home.

  • Opportunity to learn with a company that is rapidly growing along with a guaranteed training budget.

  • Friendly atmosphere and stimulating environment (pet friendly office, team events, snacks and drinks in the office, team buildings, fun budgets and events).

  • Gym membership.

  • Pension Scheme.

items.content:
komoot

 

Web Designer

verified
UTC-1 to UTC+3
**Millions of people experience real-life adventures with our apps. We help people all over the world discover the best hiking and biking routes, empowering our users to explore more of the great outdoors. And we’re good at it: Google and Apple have listed us as one of their Apps of the Year numerous times — and with more than 8 million users and 50,000 five-star reviews, komoot is on its way to becoming one of the world’s most popular cycling and hiking apps. Behind the app screen is a passionate fully remote team working from 12 countries — that’s over 50 people with a shared mission to help our users experience real-life adventures, on foot or by bike. If you’d like to help to build the future of outdoor exploration, we’re looking for a talented, enthusiastic Web Designer to join our team.** **Why you will love it** * Your work will enable millions of people to have awesome outdoor experiences * You’ll build and improve a product that we’re pretty sure you’ll end up using for your own outdoor trips * You’ll be developing in fast cycles with continuous testing and building based on direct user feedback * You will become a key player amongst a team of highly motivated and talented people * We let you work from wherever you want, be it a beach, the mountains, your house or anywhere else that lies in any time zone situated between UTC-1 and UTC+3 * You’ll travel together with our team to amazing outdoor places several times a year to exchange ideas, learnings and go for hikes and rides # Responsibilities **What you will do** * Own and drive the web design of core komoot products and take a lead on individual UX work streams * Conceptualize original web design ideas that bring simplicity and user-friendliness to complex roadblocks, and improve and optimize landing pages * Develop new layouts and interfaces and implement them in CSS and JavaScript * Create mockups, prototypes and user flows to communicate interaction and design ideas * Come up with new features as well as improve the existing ones, test ideas with users and run A/B tests * Work closely with other designers, backend team members and product managers in quick iteration cycles based on real feedback from users # Requirements **You will be successful in this position if you** * Have 3+ years of experience as a Web designer, UI/UX designer or similar role related to web-based products * Can clearly demonstrate and apply your outstanding skills in developing and implementing layouts, interfaces and user flows * Are highly skilled in HTML, CSS, Figma, and Sketch and have a good knowledge of JavaScript * Have an excellent eye for design and attention to detail: you’re obsessed with designing awesome products that users love * You are up-to-date with the latest web technologies, techniques, and features * Have experience working in a remote team, hand in hand with developers * Have good communication skills and enjoy working with teammates in quick iteration cycles based on real feedback from users #Location - UTC-1 to UTC+3

items.content:
Gravity Forms

 

Senior Designer


Worldwide
Rocketgenius, Inc. is looking for full-time Senior Designer to help us take Gravity Forms to the next level. Relocation is not necessary, as we consider your geographic location a non-issue. Hours are flexible based on your time zone requirements. # Responsibilities Reporting to the Lead Developer your responsibility will be to design Gravity Forms products. The work entails: * Collaborating with the product development team to solve challenging UX and UI problems. * Turning complex requirements into simple interfaces that are intuitive and a pleasure to use. * Optimizing existing interfaces. * Holding accountability for a consistent experience across all our products. * Establishing design guidelines, best practices and standards. * Storyboarding, wireframing, prototyping, iteration, research and testing. * Keeping your teammates informed of your tasks and progress in weekly Zoom calls, Slack and project management tools. * Giving clear but kind feedback when reviewing work by others in the team. * Contributing to customer and internal documentation. # Requirements * Your passion is to create remarkable software that is a pleasure to use. * Proven background in user experience & interface design. * Strong skills in tools and technologies required for modern web design. * Excellent verbal, written and visual communication skills. **Bonus points** * You've already figured out solutions to the challenges of remote working. * Some experience with Gravity Forms. * Experience building another high-profile WordPress plugin or theme. #Location - Worldwide

items.content:
User Research International

 

Paid Research Opportunity Developers With Data Warehouse Experience

User Research International is a research company based out of Redmond, Washington. Working with some of the biggest companies in the industry, we aim to improve your experience via paid research studies. Whether it be the latest video game or productivity tools, we value your feedback and experience. We are currently conducting a research study called Data Warehouse Study. We are looking for currently employed Full-Time Developers who recently migrated to a new data warehouse. This study is a one-time Remote Study via an online meeting. We’re offering $200 for participation in this study. Session lengths are 90 minutes. These studies provide a platform for our researchers to receive feedback for an existing or upcoming products or software. We have included the survey link for the study below. Taking the survey will help determine if you fit the profile requirements. If you complete the survey, and you are actually a fit to the study's requirements, URI will follow up with you. I have summarized the study details below. In order to be considered, you must take the survey below. Thank you! Study: Data Warehouse Study  Gratuity: $200 Session Length: 90 minutes   Location: Remote via Online Meeting  Dates: October- November  Survey: Data Warehouse Study

items.content:
Freelance UX & UI Mentoring (EU & EU Adjacent timezones)

Anywhere

freelance

We created CareerFoundry to help others build their careers while maintaining personal freedom and flexibility. Our 100% online, flexible and Mentor/Tutor driven courses are setting the standard for globally accessible technical education. As part of our mission to make career change accessible to everyone. We have partnered with the German unemployment agency (Agentur für Arbeit, AFA) to provide our courses to people who are struggling to find employment.

We are looking for experienced and passionate UX and UI designers in EU adjacent time zones to join our pool of experts and help define the next generation of design talent by educating and empowering students across the globe. Our global team of over 200 Mentors and Tutors in the web development, UX design, and UI design fields has grown to include freelancers, entrepreneurs, consultants, and agency directors who passionately guide, motivate, and empower our students to create new careers in the tech industry. We are constantly searching for more teaching enthusiasts like you to join us.

Your Mission

Mentoring and Tutoring with CareerFoundry is more than teaching. It is inspiring newcomers to the field to build, to problem solve, to think like a designer, and to increase their value as professionals. With their expertise from the field, our Mentors and Tutors provide guidance and encouragement to their students each step of the way, from sketching their first wireframe, to producing finished, functional interfaces that work across different platforms.

Based on your application and experience, we will make a decision on whether the Tutor or Mentor role is the perfect fit for you.

Tutor role:

With their expertise from the field, Tutors work with Mentors to provide guidance and encouragement to their students each step of the way. To do this, Tutors provide feedback and constructive criticism on submissions, help students understand the lessons, and ask and answer questions about the materials to deepen their understanding of the core concepts. You’ll be:

  • Regularly reviewing student projects submitted through the CareerFoundry platform
  • Portfolio reviews and checking for fundamental understanding of concepts
  • Working alongside a Mentor (who has 5+ years of experience)
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling
  • Responding to students within 12 -24 hours
Mentor role:

Most students will be beginners and are looking not only for help and experience to master the necessary skills, but also inspiration and motivation to keep them focused along the way. Mentors review students work on a regular basis with a view to how it would fit into an industry-ready portfolio. Additionally, they book one-on-one video calls to help prepare students for their entry into this new industry. They’re going to want to know how you got your start, how you network, how you decide which companies and roles to go for, and much more! Your role would involve:

  • Reviewing student projects submitted through the CareerFoundry platform
  • Portfolio reviews and checking for fundamental understanding of concepts
  • Working alongside a Tutor
  • Suggesting supplemental learning materials and personal insights in areas where students are struggling
  • Responding to students within 48 hours

Please note: Candidates who send us all the necessary documentation will be prioritised for interview

To succeed as a Mentor or Tutor, you need to have a real drive to pass on your secrets for success to the next generation of design talent.

Tutor role:
  • Bachelors in Design, Psychology, Online Marketing or related field
  • 2+ years of professional UI or UX design experience
  • A great portfolio to support your experience
  • Basic UX design knowledge and abilities are appreciated
  • In depth knowledge of industry best practices
  • A friendly personality and a strong desire to help others
  • Experience in education is an added advantage
Mentor role:
  • Minimum Masters in Design, Psychology, Online Marketing or related field
  • You have 5+ years’ experience in UI or UX design, with a demonstrable track record showcasing your work for a variety of clients and companies.
  • A first class portfolio with rock solid, relevant references to back it up.
  • Ideally, you will already have gained experience in teaching or you have the right attitude and skills for it: you have time and patience for beginners and a strong desire to guide people along their career path in this field, with knowledge of the latest design tools, a broad network of experts in the field and an in-depth understanding of industry practices.
  • Experience in education is an added advantage
What’s in it for you:
  • Flexible and mobile– work from anywhere with an internet connection
  • Educational – deepen your own knowledge of UI and UX design by teaching it to others, plus work alongside a Mentor or Tutor who will also assist with your own professional development
  • Fulfilling – directly impact students’ personal growth, and help them succeed in their goals
  • Résumé gold – mentoring and teaching experience is highly sought after by employers everywhere
AfA requirements:

As an educational institution associated with the German government, we are obligated to prove to the relevant authorities that our educational staff are qualified to teach our courses

All applicants must submit the following documents BEFORE invitations for interviews will be sent.

Everything listed on your CV needs to be supported with the relevant official paperwork. All documents must be in PDF format and not linked.

Tutors:
  • CV
  • Certificate of graduation for Bachelor degree (in a related discipline) and any additional professional certificates
  • Minimum 2 job references
  • All necessary evidence of training or further education listed in the CV
  • Portfolio
Mentor:
  • CV
  • Certificate of graduation for Bachelor and Masters degree (in a relevant discipline) and any additional professional certificates
  • Minimum 2 job references
  • All necessary evidence of training or further education listed in the CV
  • Portfolio
Apply for this job ↬

items.content:
Design Director

Full-time
Anywhere
Remote job
Mid-sized business
Posted Today – Accepting applications

Deadline to apply: November 15, 2019

Big Cartel is an e-commerce platform that’s been home to more than a million stores filled with all kinds of weird and wonderful products from around the world. We’re 100% independent and focused on helping our customers make a living doing what they love. In 2018, we were recognized by Forbes as a Small Giant™, their award for America’s best small companies. We’re a tight-knit team of 30 or so who have a deep involvement in art, music and DIY projects. We exist to help make it easier for creative people to make a living from their work.

We’re looking for a hands-on Design Director with strong UX/UI and brand development skills to help shape the future of this fun, weird, creative, inclusive, and generous company. 

What you’ll do 

People management (sorta)
This is a leadership position with no direct reports, however, we’ve got designers working on product and marketing/brand looking for mentorship, guidance, and direction. A lot of this job will be working directly and regularly with those designers to help them produce high-quality work that is consistent across all of Big Cartel. You’ll also help them grow their skills and generally feel fulfilled in their careers at Big Cartel. 

Leadership team
As a member of our small leadership team you’ll have a voice helping to shape the type of company Big Cartel is, what we work on, how to do our best work, and how we can continue to build a sustainable company long into the future. We value our independence as a bootstrapped org that’s turned a profit every year. We’re not beholden to anybody but ourselves and we have strong principles and convictions. Your design vision and strategy will showcase who we are, and appeal to the independent artists we are building our tools for. 

Product design management
You’ll collaborate closely with our Product Director to help shape feature projects before kickoff, and throughout each project cycle you’ll ensure design quality, lead regular design reviews, and advocate for our users. You’ll have a key role in documenting our processes and principles, helping our team with user research, and advocating for accessibility throughout our work. 

Brand management
With our leadership goals in mind, you’ll help provide a long-term brand strategy in-line with who we are, where we want to go, and that is consistent with the product we are building. You’ll represent Big Cartel’s vision within the greater design community, and work closely with advertising, PR, social media, and our marketing site to ensure smart, consistent, and forward-thinking brand decisions.

 

What it’s like to work with us

Big Cartel offers all employees excellent benefits like paid family leave, solid insurance, 401(k) with match, $2,000 charitable match annually, and a generous PTO policy that asks you to take 4 weeks off annually and provides a 6-week sabbatical every 5 years. We pay everyone in the top 5% of salaries for job title and level based on Radford data in the Mountain Region. This means everyone gets equal pay for equal work, it also removes the option to negotiate since that generally leads to bias and inequity. 

You can work remotely from anywhere in the United States that has a solid internet connection. This job does require travel (2 to 4 nights) at least 6 times per year, possibly more, but we try to keep it comfortable and minimal because we all have lives outside of work.

We value diversity and inclusion, not as a trend or marketing ploy, but because it makes work better for everyone and helps us build the best product possible. We also know our industry has a bad reputation when it comes to employees from underrepresented groups, and we want to do our part to change that. We are an equal opportunity employer and don’t discriminate against any qualified applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity/orientation, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, religion (or lack thereof), body size, or any other characteristic protected by federal or state law or local ordinance.


Traits that we value
There isn’t a checklist of must-haves for this role, but a broad list of skills we think this person will eventually have. We recognize that minimum experience requirements often disadvantage people who have been in toxic jobs or have been previously discriminated against (even if discretely), that’s not us, so please still consider applying if you believe you can do this job well. 

  • Clear communication - We are a remote company that values cross-team collaboration, and this role will require a lot of that. Communicating clearly both in writing and on calls will be essential for success. 
  • Ready to lead - This is not a design job, this is a leadership role. While the occasional opportunity to stretch those design muscles may pop-up, this role is about leading our people and vision.
  • Taste for days - We’re looking for more than good design, and want your help in nurturing our unique sense of style. Big Cartel isn’t flashy, but we are fresh. We build tools for artists and creatives, so our brand needs to be appeal and reflect their independent spirits. 
  • Candor comes first - Leading a company is fulfilling but also really hard and sometimes scary. Trusting that we’re all being candid with one another and working towards a common goal is essential to making the best decisions for our team and company. 
  • Experience in the right areas - To lead design across all of Big Cartel you need to have some experience with both branding and product design. There isn’t a magic amount of experience that makes you suddenly qualified for this role, but we do need to know you can level up our brand and help our designers push out an incredible product.

items.title: Quimbee: Senior UX Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=17}
items.content:
Senior UX Designer

Roles & Responsibilities:
  • Responsible for all web and mobile UX
  • Communicate the intended experience through artifacts such as concept maps and models, storyboards, sketches, wireframes, taxonomies, user flows, personas, workflows, prototypes, and design specification
  • Collaborate closely with product managers and development to take projects from early business requirements to rapidly create and validate a product vision
  • Defend design choices using previous user research, heuristics and usability standards
  • Collaborate with product management and engineering to define and implement innovative solutions for the product direction, visuals, and experience

Requirements
  • 7+ years of UX design experience
  • Proficiency with Sketch, Photoshop, Illustrator
  • Extensive knowledge of prototyping tools (Invision, Marvel, Principle, Origami)
  • Experience with HTML, CSS, and Javascript
  • Experience working at scale with style guides, pattern libraries, or design systems
  • Experience working closely with engineers to develop and iterate on interactive software experiences
  • Experience designing for a variety of screen sizes and platforms: for fully responsive web experiences and/or for mobile (touch-device) apps
  • Solid understanding of UX design best practices, specifically with e-commerce and SaaS applications, as well as mobile and responsive design
  • Excellent communication skills and an ability to work closely with creative, technical, and business stakeholders
  • Bachelor’s degree in design or related field
  • Must have link to portfolio that includes desktop as well as mobile examples
To be able to evaluate your skills and get back to all candidates, we’d really appreciate to have a portfolio with your application. We’re looking for an insight on your methodology and design thinking, not just final designs. Personas, flows, wireframes, sketches – they’re all provide great insights for us. So while we’re very happy to browse your Dribbble profile, please attach some more behind-the-scenes material if you have it handy!

Benefits
  • Join a small team of people who love what they do
  • Work from home
  • A competitive salary (ranging from $100k to $140k per year, depending on experience)
  • Healthcare coverage (including dental) for you and your family
  • Untracked paid time off and sick leave
  • 401(k) with 3% company matching

items.title: Wild West Media: Graphic Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=35}
items.content:
Graphic Designer

Who We Are
Wild West Media provides competitive advertising strategies to the top 1% of Amazon Sellers. We create story-driven instructional courses to educate and empower Amazon Sellers to scale their business with Amazon Advertising. We combine Western-themed stories with cutting-edge instructional design to create an engaging, interactive experience for our students.

Who You Are
You are a senior graphic designer with experience in presentation design, print, and website layouts focused on usability and user experience. Your design style is minimal and polished, never frivolous or cliché. You have a natural instinct for layout, balance, and typographical detailing. You’re able to create story-driven brand assets with a single font family and bold graphic elements. 

You’re confident in your ability to visually design InDesign presentations and PDF study guides that are both engaging and executable.  You combine Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign effortlessly in your daily workflow. You have the ability to work quickly and efficiently and welcome collaboration and creative feedback.

We’re looking for a designer that can merge story and instruction without sacrificing the quality of either element.  You’ll incorporate our existing brand and story assets into a new, fresh, and information-based style. 

Graphic Designer Responsibilities:
  • Create balanced text and graphic layouts in Adobe Photoshop and InDesign
  • Produce 60-90 slide assets from a template weekly for online presentation decks
  • Produce text-based, visual step-by-step study guides in Adobe InDesign and Acrobat
  • Collaborate with the subject matter expert and creative team remotely via Slack and video conferencing
  • Manage asset workflow between the Storyline Designer, Illustrator, and Subject Matter Expert
  • Lead the design of our websites from conception to completion with a seasoned coder
  • Design balanced, story-driven website and landing page layouts 

Graphic Designer Requirements:
  • Knowledge of basic design principles; composition, layout, typography, and color
  • Experience creating infographics, diagrams, and data visualization designs
  • Extensive experience with Adobe Photoshop, InDesign, Illustrator, and Adobe Creative Suite
  • Experience collaborating with creative teams of 3 or more people
  • Critical thinking skills to generate original and innovative ideas and concepts
  • Skilled at identifying problems in complex layouts and proactively creating solutions
  • Experience creating multiple drafts and refining your work to achieve excellence
  • Digital storytelling and content creation experience 

Essential Software Experience:
Adobe Photoshop (5+ years)
Adobe InDesign (5+ years)
Adobe Illustrator
Adobe Acrobat

Wild West Media values and rewards loyalty and hard work. We’re committed to creating great work experiences for our team with opportunities for advancement. 
____________
Wild West Media has been scaling search and display campaigns in competitive markets for 15+ years. If you’re interested in seeing our brand and presentation style, here’s a link to our CEO, Cherie Yvette, presenting on Amazon Advertising:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SyD0JjNbVic&t=58s

Applicants must provide samples of relevant work to be considered for the position. Please send design and layout samples in PDF format and/or a link to your online portfolio.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please e-mail a resumé and cover letter, including details about yourself and your graphic design experience, to cherie@theurbancowgirl.com.

items.title: UX Researcher (Remote OK)
items.content:
Company OverviewFounded in 2007, Theorem (formerly Citrusbyte) is a technology consulting company with a focus on how we do the work as a means to achieve great results.Our customers, F1000's and startups alike, come to us because they need to change how something is done in order to succeed and they're looking for a solution that isn't just about technology - but also people, process and leadership. We consult, form a diverse team of experts, and deliver strategy and execution all under one roof.Our services range from new product development, pure R&D, legacy modernization, pricing strategy development, revenue generation, process optimization, to organizational transformation and cultural design.Working at TheoremAt Theorem, we believe that creating an environment where great people can flourish is the best strategy for our business and the best way to solve our client's problems and deliver the greatest value.Our focus on culture is supported by our shared vision to build a company where we want to work for the long-term. We avoid egos and embrace distributed leadership. We grow from constantly being challenged and seek to understand when presented with ideas we don't understand. We respect each other, default to trust and treat each other like adults and we also hold each other accountable for commitments. There is a lot about our culture that makes us great and we're continually looking to improve it. Read what we've published about our culture.Job SummaryAs a UX Researcher you will work with small cross functional teams to create and execute on research plans. You will be responsible for surfacing research insights that will inspire product strategy. This new addition to our team is a curious person, has a strong sense of humility and deeply cares about solving the right problem.Theorem works with Fortune 500 clients which requires a researcher who is a natural consultant that is comfortable presenting to and engaging with clients that range from stakeholders to C-Suite executives. Our practice will benefit from the candidate's proactive and thoughtful recommendations integrating research into Theorem's fast-paced product development culture.This is a remote friendly role. Candidates within North America will be given priority for the sake of travel and team time zone alignment.Responsibilities And Duties Lead research for discovery and iterative product development initiatives Partner with Product Managers and Designers recommending research practices and providing UX feedback on solutions Plan, conduct, synthesize and communicate research findings to the internal team and our clients Develop an understanding of our client's users, their competition and the marketplace Produce clear and impactful artifacts that surface the most meaningful stories from the research findings Coordinate recruiting, scheduling and communication with research participants Manage relationships with third-party research vendors when needed Qualifications And Skills 7+ years of product design research experience Seasoned practitioner in both qualitative and quantitative research, with an appreciation for applying lean methodologies to process Experience with both generative and evaluative research initiatives Demonstrates expertise with preparation for and execution of interviewing, concept testing, usability testing, ethnographic research, diary studies, heuristic evaluations, surveys, personas, journey maps, remote testing and benchmarks
Product pricing research experience is an added plus Willingness to travel Benefits And Perks 100% remote Once a year the entire Theorem team gets together at an inspiring location to meet, work and play. This year's retreat was in Tuscany, Italy! We offer paid vacation and support healthy lifestyles through our physical fitness benefits program We have comprehensive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance plans, plus we have a 401k plan Theorem expects employees to be honest, trustworthy, and operate with integrity. Discrimination and all unlawful harassment (including sexual harassment) in employment is not tolerated. We encourage success based on our individual merits and abilities, and all decisions regarding recruitment, hiring, promotion, compensation, employee development decisions such as training, and all other terms and conditions of employment, will be made without regard to race, nationality, national origin, citizenship status, employment status, ethnicity, ethnic origin, color, creed, religion, belief, age, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender identity, sexual preference, lifestyle, social class, military status, disability, physical features, or any other protected status. We oppose all forms of unlawful or unfair discrimination. Theorem is an equal opportunity employer.No statements by Theorem are intended to create an offer of employment unless made in a writing signed by an officer of the company and no offer shall become effective unless countersigned by the prospective employee.mAllgGEGUD

items.title: Digital Painter
items.content:
Digital Painter at Tales Writer

Remote | Freelance | International

Location: Anywhere (freelance)

We’re building a platform for interactive storytelling. It’s time we changed the way stories are created and published. We think individual creators should be able to pilot ideas, iterate off feedback/metrics, control how they monetize, and add visuals/interactivity to bring stories to life on mobile devices.

We’re looking for GREAT digital painters to help bring GREAT interactive stories to life. You’ll be working on the kind of stories that get people excited! You’ll be working with writers from around the world on the type of stories you get excited about (seriously does the world need another first person shooter??).

  • Must be a master in Photoshop.
  • Must have exceptional painting skills.
  • Strong sense of color and dramatic lighting.
  • Must have a strong sense of volume and 3 dimensional space.
  • Must be proficient in English.
  • Experience working professionally with a game or entertainment studio.
  • Our best work is done through collaboration with art directors. Must be capable of taking feedback and revisiting ideas with a fresh eye.
Apply for job

items.title: Doist: Marketing Designer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=8, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Marketing Designer

At Doist, our mission is to inspire the workplace of the future by creating simple yet powerful productivity tools that promote a more fulfilling way to work and live.

We're a multidisciplinary, fully remote team that’s passionate about creating products, like Todoist and Twist, that improve people’s lives. We thrive on innovating new solutions to old productivity challenges and we seek to rethink how productivity tools are made.

When you become a Doister, you’re not only joining a global, remote-first company, but a team of 60+ people who value:
  • Feeling empowered to achieve their ambitions
  • Inclusivity, open-mindedness, and diversity
  • The wellbeing of their teammates and the people around them
  • Making long-term, high-impact decisions, even if they’re harder
We invite you to visit our blog to learn more about us, our values, and how we work.

Your role:

Doist’s Design team crafts engaging experiences that help make people’s lives more productive. Whether ideating marketing pages or functional interfaces, design is always a core priority for Doist. We are now looking for a talented designer to join our international team.

As a marketing Designer at Doist, you’ll have the opportunity to collaborate not only with the other designers on the team but also with members of the development and marketing teams in order to ensure that our communication is effective, aesthetically pleasing and promotes balance. We're looking for someone who can join us to take Doist's design to the next level by creating solutions that perform beautifully on every platform, independent of the user's preference.

About you:

To thrive as a Marketing Designer at Doist, you: 
  • Have 2-5 years of experience in a similar role
  • Are skilled in user experience and digital marketing design (websites, emails, etc)
  • Have a thorough understanding of digital typesetting (typography)
  • Pay meticulous attention to the finer details
  • Have experience working in a variety of platforms and media, including web, print, interactive, email and social 
  • Are comfortable working with– and eventually evolving– pre-existing design libraries 
  • Have experience working on branding design
  • Are responsible, a team-player and happy to take the initiative
  • Have the ability to be able to form, prototype and confidently present ideas
  • Are fluent in written and spoken English
  • Are comfortable communicating with a multicultural team with diverse communication styles
Bonus:
  • Previous icon, illustration and animation work
  • Knowledge of HTML, CSS, and GIT

Benefits:

We’re bootstrapped, profitable, and committed to building a sustainable company that will grow for decades to come. We’ve built a benefits package that invests in our employee’s long-term personal and professional growth and well-being. Here’s a sample of what that includes:
  • Work-Life balance. That means 8 hours of work, 5 days each week (for a total of 40 hours) because the time you spend outside of work is just as important as the time you spend working.
  • Flexible schedule and location. This is a fully remote position, so you can work from wherever you please and on a schedule that works best for you. All you need is a computer and access to a stable internet connection (which we sponsor!).
  • Generous paid vacation. 40 days of paid time off to use however you like (vacation, national holidays, etc.).
  • Paid parental leave. 18 weeks of paid maternity leave and 5 weeks of paid paternity/adoption leave.
  • Education stipend. You’ll have a monthly budget to buy books, courses, and other resources you need to continue learning and developing.
  • Competitive compensation.
  • And much more!

items.title: Senior UX Designer with Strong UI Foundation at Scalable Path
items.content:
Senior UX Designer with Strong UI Foundation

About this job

Job type: Contract
Experience level: Senior
Role: Designer
Industry: Recruiting, Software Development
Company size: 11–50 people
Company type: Private
Company: Scalable Path | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+02:00) Helsinki +/- 2 hours

Technologies

user-interface
user-experience
design

Job description

We are looking for a Senior UX Designer with Strong UI Foundation to join the Scalable Path team to work on a client project. This is a remote, full-time position.

CLIENT COMPANY DESCRIPTION:
The client is a well established, but growing, company in the on-demand cloud printing space. They provide the most cost-efficient and environmentally-friendly print solution for global companies through having a global network of world-class printers to carry out printing locally. Their ambition is to cut 90% of print-related transportation and reduce companies' print costs by 50% to benefit both their customers and the planet.

The client's development teams are highly ambitious and nurture a startup-style culture. Currently, the brand has over 3 million customers and they have grown 400% in 4 years. They have also achieved the highest customer satisfaction rates in their industry.

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
The client is expanding via its API service. This project is in its early stages and they need a UX designer with a strong UI foundation to make their API services easy and accessible. They are looking for someone who can draw inspiration from businesses solving the same problems (such as Stripe, Twilio, Salesforce and Shopify) while also bringing new ideas on board.

As the Senior UX/UI Designer, you will work on the API portal experience where customers will manage their accounts. The client wants their customers to be able to quickly and efficiently self-serve where possible with their orders, usage, billing, etc. You will look to understand their unique selling points and find the best way to convey them to their customers via their marketing web pages.

RELATIONSHIPS - WHO YOU'LL BE WORKING WITH:
You will be the sole designer on this project, working with a dynamic set of engineers and project managers. There is an existing daily meeting at 9:00am Europe/Oslo (+02:00) CEST.

REQUIRED SKILLS:
- Excellent written and spoken communication in English
- Designing experiences that equally consider user needs, business goals, and tech feasibility
- Creating and working with a design system to maintain UI consistency
- Solid understanding of UI principles and ability to justify your design recommendations with evidence
- Conduct usability tests on prototypes and live products to understand what is working well and what needs to be improved
- Experience with Figma (or other similar design tools)
- Able to think on your feet in a fast-paced environment, plan
ahead, and communicate risks early and often.

DESIRED (NICE-TO-HAVE) SKILLS:
- You have previously worked on tools or platforms primarily used by software engineers

START DATE:
As soon as possible.

EXPECTED CONTRACT DURATION:
3-6 months

HOURLY RATE:

The pay rate for this role is from $30 to $50 USD per hour, depending on experience and capability.


NOTES:
- This position is primarily remote but will likely require travel to Oslo, Norway for some days of in-house work with the team each month.
- There will be two client interviews for this role, in addition to the two Scalable Path interviews.

If you're interested, please DO NOT apply via StackOverflow - follow the link below and click the "Login to Apply" button:

https://www.scalablepath.com/view-position/47796de5/…

Apply now

About Scalable Path

Scalable Path is a group of visionary strategists and technologists, headquartered in San Francisco, with a network of top talent worldwide. We work with companies to understand their business, technology, creative, and marketing needs. Then we put the right team, technologies, and processes in place to design, build and deliver awesome digital products. Our clients can work directly with their team in a staff augmentation model, or have a Scalable Path leader manage the project end-to-end. Whatever your organizational structure, we can fill in the gaps where needed.

With over 5,000 developers from over 114 countries, you can take advantage of a huge talent pool and lower costs while collaborating with a team in your time zone.

Benefits

  • 100% Remote
  • Exciting Projects
  • Leading Edge Technologies
  • Competitive Pay
